text: I love the brightness of these fish
cakes they're just so vibrant I'm using
chillies which just adds a kick
I've got chopped fresh herbs and then I
also have grated lime zest and then the
whole thing is just very alive very
fresh tasting and very different from
the usual fish cake I have sort of cake
right here and I'm going to add a little
bit of brown caramelized flavor what I'm
looking for here is just to get the
garlic a little bit browned and now I'm
going to add my fish if your fish is not
fitted hold the fin part over a little
bit of vermouth or white wine a little
water cook it until it's just tender
enough to flake see how nicely this just
comes right out of the pan it's just
breaking into large flakes and leaving
the garlic in the pan so I will have a
garlicky mashed potatoes to mix in with
my fish not just regular mashed potatoes
just add flavor at every point sliced
potatoes turn the heat back on and add
water to cover the fish kind of sticks
to the sizes of Browns and the potatoes
are going to bring up every little bit
while the potatoes are cooking I'm just
going to flake the fish it's going to
get mixed with the potatoes so I'm not
going to flake it into really small
pieces now you just drain these and add
them to the fish you don't have to worry
about getting the potatoes ultra smooth
but you do want to find those little
garlic's and really get them and this
goes into the fish now I'm going to add
a bunch of stuff lime zest add a little
Cayenne use the back end of a fork
Serrano chili I like to use both the
white and the green part of the scallion
I'm gonna chop my basil and my cilantro
all together right as well
bread crumbs to bind everything together
I like panko because I think it's a bit
lighter and the eggs let's do the
two-handed thing you have to do this
ahead of time because you need to chill
it in order to get it firm enough to
form into patties
ideally four to six hours ahead or if
you're a planner do it the day before
nice and cold and they just want to form
them into patties and then dip them in
the flour you could serve these as they
are but I like Curtis offs
I love mayonnaise and I'm going to use
pretty much anything pungent and citrusy
you could use preserve lemon you could
use lime pickle and if you don't have
either one you could also just take this
mayonnaise and dollop it right on the
top that's delicious do a little more do
this to taste once you know how to make
these they're really versatile you could
make them little and you can serve them
as it a little hors d'oeuvre but I like
them as a main course because that way I
get to eat a lot of them
